name: accuracy
title: Accuracy
description: How you keep your data up-to-date

elements.name: serviceType
elements.title: Does the data behind your API change?

choices.text: No, the API gives access to unchanging data
Yes, the API gives access to changing data

elements.name: timeSensitive
elements.title: Will your data go out of date?

choices.text: Yes, this data will go out of date
Yes, this data will go out of date over time but itâ€™s time stamped
No, this data does not contain any time-sensitive information

elements.name: provideDumps
elements.title: Do you also publish dumps of this dataset?
elements.description: A dump is an extract of the whole dataset into a file that people can download. This lets people do analysis that's different to analysis with API access.

elements.name: dumpFrequency
elements.title: How frequently do you create a new database dump?

choices.text: Less frequently than once a month

choices.description: You should create a new database dump every month so that people have the latest data.

choices.text: Within a week of any change
choices.description: You should create a new database dump within a week of any change so that people have less time to wait for the latest data.

choices.text: Within a day of any change
choices.description: You should create a new database dump within a day of any change so that people find it easier to get the latest data.

elements.description: Faster access to more frequent extracts of the whole dataset means people can get started quicker with the most up-to-date data.

elements.name: corrected
elements.title: Will your data be corrected if it has errors?
elements.description: It's good practice to fix errors in your data, especially if you use it yourself. When you make corrections, people need to be told about them.

elements.name: frequentChanges
elements.title: Does this data change at least daily?
elements.description: Tell people if the underlying data changes on most days. When data changes frequently, it also goes out of date quickly, so people need to know if you also update it frequently and quickly too.

requirement.progressText: You need to tell people how often the data changes.

elements.name: seriesType
elements.title: What type of dataset series is this?

choices.text: Regular copies of a complete database
choices.description: Choose if you publish new and updated copies of your full database regularly. When you create database dumps, it's useful for people to have access to a feed of the changes so they can keep their copies up to date.
Choose if you create new datasets regularly. You might do this if the underlying data can't be released as open data or if you only publish data that's new since the last publication.

elements.name: changeFeed
elements.title: Is a feed of changes available?
elements.description: Tell people if you provide a stream of changes that affect this data, like new entries or amendments to existing entries. Feeds might be in RSS, Atom, or custom formats.

elements.name: frequentSeriesPublication
elements.title: How often do you create a new release?

choices.description: You should create a new dataset release every month so people keep their copies up-to-date and accurate.
You should create a new dataset release every week so people keep their copies up-to-date and accurate.
You should create a new dataset release every day so people keep their copies up-to-date and accurate.

elements.name: seriesPublicationDelay
elements.title: How long is the delay between when you create a dataset and when you publish it?

choices.text: Longer than the gap between releases
choices.description: For example, if you create a new version of the dataset every day, choose this if it takes more than a day for it to be published.

choices.text: About the same as the gap between releases
choices.description: You should have a reasonable delay between when you create and publish a dataset that is less than the gap between releases so people keep their copies up-to-date and accurate.

choices.text: Less than half the gap between releases
choices.description: You should have a short delay between when you create and publish a dataset that is less than half the gap between releases so people keep their copies up-to-date and accurate.
You should have minimal or no delay between when you create and publish a dataset so people keep their copies up-to-date and accurate.
